com.arcrobotics.ftclib.hardware

Class ExternalEncoder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.arcrobotics.ftclib.hardware.ExternalEncoder
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    JSTEncoder

    public abstract class ExternalEncoder
extends java.lang.Object
    This abstract class can be extended to make your own external encoder hardware classes.
    1. Add your type of motor as an instance variable.(eg. private DcMotor encoder)
    2. Fill in the abstract methods.
    If you are using Rev Extensiosn 2, it is highly encouraged that you use the Bulk Data Input feature. This is to be used with the private Expansion Hub Motor. Simply pass the bulk data object in your constructor and store the reference in this class (eg. private RevBulkData bulkData).

      abstract void syncEncoder()

    • Method Detail

      • getCounts

        public abstract long getCounts()

      • syncEncoder

        public abstract void syncEncoder()
        Syncs the recorded counts with the current counts reported by the encoder. For simplicity reasons, it is always better to do this than change the mode to STOP_AND_RESET_ENCODER . However, this option should still exist.
        See Also:
        resetEncoder()

      • resetEncoder

        public abstract void resetEncoder()
        Hard resets the encoder. It is good to avoid this form of resetting if possible, as it takes up more bus time. Regardless, it is good to have this option. Inside this method, change the runMode to STOP_AND_RESET_ENCODER and then back to RUN_WITHOUT_ENCODER.
